amendment.description: Amendment originally sought to to allow a class action to be removed to a Federal court only after a State court has certified the class. \ As amended by the Boucher substitute amendment (A004), the above was replaced with language which allows named or representative class members to remove to a Federal court prior to the State order certifying the class.
amendment.purpose: An amendment no. 7 printed in the Congressional Record to allow a class action to be removed to a district court of the United States only after a State has certified the class.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Watt (NC) amendment (A003) as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
